DataElement.preferredDefinition: Code assigned to describe the patient's response or outcome to the disease.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Workflow and Registration Status Changed per Brenda Duggan; 05.16.18 This DEC is used in a GDC CDE. Changed WF to Released and RS to Application to allow for reuse of the CDE in a TCIA study per request by D.Warzel. 4.23.09 mc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: At a point before the usual, expected, or specified time.

Concepts.definition: At a point before the usual, expected, or specified time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.: The worsening of a disease over time.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
A process that manifests as the worsening of a disease over time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The confirmed disappearance of all signs of cancer, and absence of molecular or cytogenetic marker of disease, in response to treatment with additional biochemical, immunological and histopathological analyses to verify the CR.

Concepts.definition: The confirmed disappearance of all signs of cancer, and absence of molecular or cytogenetic marker of disease, in response to treatment with additional biochemical, immunological and histopathological analyses to verify the CR.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Added concept annotation and changed case of Long Name. mc 4/11/17

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A radiographic procedure using the emission of penetrating energy waves to form an image of the structure penetrated by the radiation.: A disease process that is increasing in scope or severity.

Concepts.definition: A radiographic procedure using the emission of penetrating energy waves to form an image of the structure penetrated by the radiation.
A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.

Concepts.definition: Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Added concept annotation and capitalized Long Name. mc 4/11/17

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Concepts.definition: Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A marked decrease in contrast enhancement that is not due to actual tumor shrinkage, but that may be due to anti-angiogenic therapy or an increase in steroid dosage.

Concepts.definition: A marked decrease in contrast enhancement that is not due to actual tumor shrinkage, but that may be due to anti-angiogenic therapy or an increase in steroid dosage.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A radiologic finding observed during magnetic resonance imaging of brain glioblastoma, following concurrent radiotherapy and temozolomide treatment or vaccine therapy. It refers to the false positive finding of progression and enhancement of the lesion. It is considered a treatment effect due to tumor cell necrosis and subsequent edema formation and increased vascular permeability.

Concepts.definition: A radiologic finding observed during magnetic resonance imaging of brain glioblastoma, following concurrent radiotherapy and temozolomide treatment or vaccine therapy. It refers to the false positive finding of progression and enhancement of the lesion. It is considered a treatment effect due to tumor cell necrosis and subsequent edema formation and increased vascular permeability.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any action or response, without curative intent, that mitigates some or all of the unpleasant effects of a disease or condition.: The positive effects of something.

Concepts.definition: Any action or response, without curative intent, that mitigates some or all of the unpleasant effects of a disease or condition.
The positive effects of something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any action or response, without curative intent, that mitigates some or all of the unpleasant effects of a disease or condition.: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: Any action or response, without curative intent, that mitigates some or all of the unpleasant effects of a disease or condition.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: Any action or response, without curative intent, that mitigates some or all of the unpleasant effects of a disease or condition.: The positive effects of something.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Any action or response, without curative intent, that mitigates some or all of the unpleasant effects of a disease or condition.
The positive effects of something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response that is described as not clinical or not progressive and not clinical or not progressive.

The smallest possible quantity.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: Of questionable or minimal quality; just barely adequate or within a lower limit.: The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

Concepts.definition: The smallest possible quantity.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Of questionable or minimal quality; just barely adequate or within a lower limit.
The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A marked increase in contrast enhancement that is not due to actual tumor growth, but that may be due to a reaction to immunotherapy.

Concepts.definition: A marked increase in contrast enhancement that is not due to actual tumor growth, but that may be due to a reaction to immunotherapy.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A marked decrease in contrast enhancement that is not due to actual tumor shrinkage, but that may be due to immunotherapy.

Concepts.definition: A marked decrease in contrast enhancement that is not due to actual tumor shrinkage, but that may be due to immunotherapy.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Disease or Disorder About The Same

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Disease or Disorder About The Same
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.: In an unchanged or similar condition.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
The status is unaltered or similar to the previous state.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: Having been established or verified.: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Having been established or verified.
The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.: The worsening of a disease over time.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
A process that manifests as the worsening of a disease over time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any therapy that is administered to augment or stimulate other treatment modalities or to minimize or prevent disease recurrence subsequent to the main treatment plan.

Concepts.definition: Any therapy that is administered to augment or stimulate other treatment modalities or to minimize or prevent disease recurrence subsequent to the main treatment plan.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated definition to match current NCIt. mc 4/11/17

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Involving or composed of different kinds.: The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

Concepts.definition: Involving or composed of different kinds.
The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No apparent change or worsening in lesion staging classification.

Concepts.definition: No apparent change or worsening in lesion staging classification.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Added concept annotation and changed case of Long Name. mc 4/11/17

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cancer that is increasing in scope or severity.

Concepts.definition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A decrease in the size of a tumor, or in the extent of cancer in the body, in response to treatment.

Concepts.definition: A decrease in the size of a tumor, or in the extent of cancer in the body, in response to treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cancer that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity.

Concepts.definition: A disease that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Partial response with additional serum and urine M-protein reduction, but not meeting complete response.

Concepts.definition: Partial response with additional serum and urine M-protein reduction, but not meeting complete response.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not far distant in time or space or degree or circumstances.: The disappearance of all signs of cancer, supported by pathological examination.

Concepts.definition: Not far distant in time or space or degree or circumstances.
The disappearance of all signs of cancer, supported by pathological examination.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer, supported by pathological examination.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer, supported by pathological examination.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not provided or available.

Concepts.definition: Not provided or available.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: There is evidence of a tumor in an individual.

Concepts.definition: There is evidence of a tumor in an individual.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: There is no evidence of a tumor in the individual.

Concepts.definition: There is no evidence of a tumor in the individual.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Retained; never-ceasing.: Of or belonging to both a local and regional area of the body.: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Concepts.definition: Retained; never-ceasing.
Of or belonging to both a local and regional area of the body.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Retained; never-ceasing.: A biological process that involves the transfer and growth of cancer cells from the site of the primary tumor. Relocation of malignant cells during metastasis can be restricted to movement within a specific tissue/organ or may entail migration to a distal locus within the body. This phenotype is a characteristic of all malignant tumors.

Concepts.definition: Retained; never-ceasing.

A biological process that involves the transfer and growth of cancer cells from the site of the primary tumor. Relocation of malignant cells during metastasis can be restricted to movement within a specific tissue/organ or may entail migration to a distal locus within the body. This phenotype is a characteristic of all malignant tumors.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of or relating to biochemistry; involving chemical processes in living organisms.: Knowledge on which to base belief.: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Concepts.definition: Of or relating to biochemistry; involving chemical processes in living organisms.
Knowledge on which to base belief.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
